labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed for automating interactions with mobile applications across iOS and Android platforms. Its core functionality includes device management, app launch/termination, screen interaction (clicks, swipes, text input), screen analysis (element detection, screenshots), and orientation control. The server leverages structured accessibility data or coordinate-based actions to perform complex user journeys, making it valuable for testing, data entry, and process automation. The provided tools enable seamless automation of mobile app workflows without manual intervention.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is "Browser Automation" because the server focuses on automating interactions with mobile applications, similar to web browser automation but for mobile apps. The secondary label "Development Tools" is relevant due to its use in automated testing and app interaction workflows. "Custom Labels" are not necessary as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: mobile_list_available_devices
tools.description: List all available devices. This includes both physical devices and simulators. If there is more than one device returned, you need to let the user select one of them.

tools.name: mobile_use_device
tools.description: Select a device to use. This can be a simulator or an Android device. Use the list_available_devices tool to get a list of available devices.

device.description: The name of the device to select

deviceType.description: The type of device to select

tools.name: mobile_list_apps
tools.description: List all the installed apps on the device

tools.name: mobile_launch_app
tools.description: Launch an app on mobile device. Use this to open a specific app. You can find the package name of the app by calling list_apps_on_device.

packageName.description: The package name of the app to launch

tools.name: mobile_terminate_app
tools.description: Stop and terminate an app on mobile device

packageName.description: The package name of the app to terminate

tools.name: mobile_get_screen_size
tools.description: Get the screen size of the mobile device in pixels

tools.name: mobile_click_on_screen_at_coordinates
tools.description: Click on the screen at given x,y coordinates

x.description: The x coordinate to click on the screen, in pixels

y.description: The y coordinate to click on the screen, in pixels

tools.name: mobile_list_elements_on_screen
tools.description: List elements on screen and their coordinates, with display text or accessibility label. Do not cache this result.

tools.name: mobile_press_button
tools.description: Press a button on device

button.description: The button to press. Supported buttons: BACK (android only), HOME, VOLUME_UP, VOLUME_DOWN, ENTER, DPAD_CENTER (android tv only), DPAD_UP (android tv only), DPAD_DOWN (android tv only), DPAD_LEFT (android tv only), DPAD_RIGHT (android tv only)

tools.name: mobile_open_url
tools.description: Open a URL in browser on device

tools.name: swipe_on_screen
tools.description: Swipe on the screen

tools.name: mobile_type_keys
tools.description: Type text into the focused element

submit.description: Whether to submit the text. If true, the text will be submitted as if the user pressed the enter key.

tools.name: mobile_take_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the mobile device. Use this to understand what's on screen, if you need to press an element that is available through view hierarchy then you must list elements on screen instead. Do not cache this result.

tools.name: mobile_set_orientation
tools.description: Change the screen orientation of the device

tools.name: mobile_get_orientation
tools.description: Get the current screen orientation of the device

server_info_crawled.name: Mobile Automation Server
server_info_crawled.author: @mobile-next/mobile-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Automate mobile applications seamlessly across iOS and Android platforms. Interact with native apps using structured accessibility data or coordinate-based actions, enhancing your testing and data-entry workflows. Leverage the power of LLMs to drive complex user journeys without manual intervention.

tools.name: mobile_list_available_devices

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mobile-next/mobile-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
